intro: Malesherbia humilis var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered malesherbia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub with hairy, glandular leaves. Its flowers are small, usually pink or purple, and are clustered in inflorescences. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
